headline: Spiced Pumpkin Seeds
description: Make this snack by roasting fresh pumpkin seeds in margarine, Worcestershire sauce, and garlic salt.
name: Spiced Pumpkin Seeds

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 275 degrees F (135 degrees C).
Combine the margarine, salt, garlic salt, Worcestershire sauce and pumpkin seeds. Mix thoroughly and place in shallow baking dish.

review.reviewBody: I’ve made this several times and each time they are gone quickly. My family loves them. I rinsed and clean the pulp off the seeds and let dry over night. Well actually a few days busy schedule. Double and Used olive oil only 1/2 tsp of salt , garlic powder instead of the garlic salt to my 4 cups of seeds. Delicious!
I have made this a couple times. I keep the basic instructions and ingredients, butter and Worcestershire. Then change the seasoning
Taste was great, texture was not. Will follow other’s tips for throughly drying the seeds before throwing them in oven next time.
This was delicious! Made as directed except only cooked 30 mins
I followed this recipe for my acorn squash seeds and it worked perfectly thanks for the recipe
Used seasoned salt, garlic powder, olive oil...yum!!!
The only thing that I did differently was to boil the cleaned, dried seeds in salted water, then dried before following the recipe. Spot on delish!

Excellent cooking method and seasonings. I boiled minutes then pored into strainer and rinsed with cold water until seeds were cool. Let drip in Strainer while i made seasoning. Did 1/2 butter/veg oil and DOUBLED the rest of spice and flavoring. Followed baking instructions exactly, no issues with burning. I think because of using veg oil and NOT drying seeds.
We substituted Earth Balance for butter and used garlic powder. They are crispy but not overly and have a lot of flavor. They are satisfying for the crunch and salt need. A great healthy snack.
Yum! These are my favorite! I doubled the ingredients for 3 cups of seeds and piled them on a parchment-lined baking sheet for 1.25 hours. Stirred once. They are just perfect.

Really tasty and so easy to make! The Worcestershire sauce made me pause but it works perfectly for these. My kids love it and think it taste exactly like microwave popcorn (but I didn’t tell them it’s healthier ??) You can reduce the salt (since the worchestershire sauce has sodium) and I used coarse sea salt to add more texture. Will be saving this to make next fall
I don't like garlic salt so I used garlic powder. I also cooked at 280 for 1.5 hours stirring every 15 minutes. That made it 5 stars for me.
Yummy!!!
I also quadrupled the recipe and did half salt, half seasoning. Baked at 300 for 1 hour and they are perfect! I added salt right after they came out as well and mixed it in! My boys love them!
I quadrupled the recipe and used 3 cups of seeds, cooked it as instructed. It was gone in hours - everyone loved it. Do not need to pre boil the seeds!

Amazing! I doubled the spice mix because I read the comments and I used olive oil like the video said in place of butter. I will be making these again soon! I will be actually be buying pumpkins just for the seeds lol looks like our carving and baking skills are gonna improve too!

They turned out awesome. I tweaked the recipe a bit, didn’t have Worcestershire sauce and I used onion salt, garlic salt and a Smokey spice blend. I baked them for 30 mins in the shallow pan then I transferred them to a baking sheet for another 30 mins to make sure the roasted evenly and browned evenly. My 5 year old loves them.
Love it! I make these every fall!
Love this recipe. Super savory with lots of flavor, and crunchy delicious texture you don't want to stop eating.
Amazing flavor! It’s added some seasoned salt and cooked for a few minutes longer than an hour to make it extra crunchy! Thanks!

I used 2 tsp seasoned salt instead of the 1/2 tsp salt, and kept everything else the same. Also, I do NOT wash off the pumpkin seeds or soak them in salt water. Instead, just pull off the pumpkin threads, but leave them covered in the pumpkin 'goo'. Gives them more of a pumpkin flavor that way. I do cook them a little slower as it helps them to dry off and break down the seeds a bit better.

Was looking for a roasted pumpkin seed recipe. Some said to boil and dry first. I researched why you would want to do that. Results said that pumpkin seeds cook unevenly with the inside cooking faster than the shell resulting in burned insides. So ...

I boiled for 10 minutes in salty water first as suggested. Mixed up the spices, butter and seeds in a bowl and spread on a cookie sheet. Stirred every 10 minutes for about 65 minutes. They were perfect. Now I'll tailor the spices/salt ratio to my taste. All in all a good recipe.
love at first smell

Thanks for sharing! This stuff is addicting!! As recommended by other reviews, I doubled the recipe for 2 cups pumpkin seeds. I was also looking for a spicy recipe and decided to add 1/2 tsp cayenne pepper. The flavor had a buttery smokiness to it that was delicious. T I used these on raw in-shell pumpkins seeds from Halloween pumpkins, I was disappointed at the thought of having to wait a year until next Halloween or until we dared to make pumpkin pie from real pumpkin. So I just bought raw unshelled pumpkin seeds, cashews, pecans and almonds. I am excited to try this recipe on those so I can enjoy this flavor year round. I hope it turns out well.

So easy and delicious, but I recommend decreasing the salt!! The recipe is perfect except I use garlic powder instead of garlic salt, no measured salt, and then only salt the seeds once they are on the pan, lightly. Even this way I still find it a challenge not to salt too much, so I can’t imagine making it as written. Worcestershire sauce has lots of salt already. We make these every Halloween evening as we carve our pumpkins.

Fantastic. I just eyeballed the listed ingredients and subed out for the olive oil. no fussing with boiling, drying ect.. nonsense.. out of the darn pumpkin into the bowl with the ingredients into the oven 250 for 60 min.. crispy, tasty delicious.
Very tasty with a satisfying crunch
I added some chili powder. Everyone loved this as a snack. Will definitely make again.

After cleaning our pumpkin, I rinsed our seeds by walking in cool water to clean them. I dried then overnight (left out on the counter) and followed this recipe with the only exception being that unused olive oil in place of margarine (personal choice). They are fantastic! Perfectly crunchy. Perfectly seasoned.
Delicious! Lightly salted taste for me, perfect for my husband, he adds more salt to his.
Great recipe. Whenever I make this for family and friends I'm asked for a copy of the recipe. Only change is I use butter and not margarine.
I did not measure any of the ingredients or seeds. I just melted 4 Tb butter and eyeballed the rest and they came out great!
i loved using this recipe and have been ever since though i have tweaked it a little over the years i still use this as the base for every batch

So simple! I buy my pumpkin seeds from Sprouts in bulk and then use the recipe and have never had a problem. I will add some different spices from time to time, but the butter and Worcestershire blend makes it so good! This is my go to whenever I crave seeds.
Best pumpkin seed recipe I have ever made. For some reason, mine didn’t required only about 20 minutes to roast on a cookie sheet. I doubled all seasoning and used olive oil instead of butter.
They were delicious!! I did use Margo’s advice from the comments to use olive oil instead of butter. Thank you both for your recipe!!
Tasted great! I subbed olive oil for butter.

So crunchy and addicting! I only had 1 1/2 cups seeds from our 2 small pumpkins, used Johnny’s instead of regular salt, and did 1/4 tsp garlic powder instead of garlic salt. I rinsed and drained seeds in a colander, then put them in preheated oven on foiled jelly roll pan to dry while I made “sauce”... about 10 min. Followed baking instructions as written. They were done in about 40 min. I just tested them each time I stirred until desired crunchiness was reached.

I boiled the seeds in salt water until grey first to soak in the seasoning and made more of the sauce. Wasn't sure I would like it with the worcestershire sauce, but I was wrong. These taste great and are very addictive!

I made this exactly as shown and my family loved it so much that my adult sons were clamoring for more! The only suggestion I have is to be sure and make a double batch because 2 cups of roasted seeds will not be enough!

Man, these are good. I did make modifications after reading the reviews - olive oil instead of margarine or butter, seasoned salt instead of regular salt and upped the spice content. But as a jumping off point, fantastic. I hope I can keep from eating them long enough to put them in some butternut squash soup.

This was my first time making pumpkin seeds, but thanks to the good folks at Allrecipes, things were made a lot easier. I picked all the seeds out and they turned out to be less than what the recipe called for. Plus I soaked them in salt water beforehand, and besides, other reviewers claimed they were a bit on the salty side. So I cut down on the salt, but that turned to be a mistake. However, they made a healthy snack (though chewier than I expected). They're good for snacking on or salads, but a little disappointing considering we only make them once a year when we carve our pumpkin. Next time we will use all the salt.
These taste amazing!
I didn’t have Worcester sauce, so I substituted it with 1 part fish sauce, 1 part soy sauce and 1 part vinegar. It turned out great!!!!!
Will make again, tastes delicious!
Absolutely the best punkin' seeds eveeeeerrrr!!!
I added Old Bay in stead of salt. was a good exchange. Next one will be Cajun spices.

I made this exactly as recipe calls for. Except doubled the ingredients. I didn’t even rinse the seeds and they were fresh after carving. They were crispy and delicious. These were delicious and will now be my yearly recipe.
this is my go to roasted pumpkin seed recipe
My husband could not get enough of these ! Loved them !
No changes. I think they are great and make them every year when we carve our pumpkins.
love it i put my own spice blend in it and it taste great
These were very tasty! I used Extra Light Olive Oil instead of margarine.
didn't have quite two cups of pumpkin seeds otherwise the same. I'd give it a 5 star + if I could.
Sooooo yummy!
Taste very good. Just not enough for me. I am a chronic over reasoner, so it was a bit plain for my taste.
A perfect snack and so easy to make.
easy & tastes great. Enjoy!!!!
Yes I used parchment paper turned out great
Great for a salad topper!
I had to add extra salt after they were done. I liked them, but my family had mixed reviews.

I picked this recipe not having baked pumpkin seeds before and they came out really well! I boiled the seeds for 10 mins and let them dry overnight. I then followed the recipe exactly using olive oil instead of butter or margarine. I stirred them every 20 mins but the full hour may have been too long. They are good regardless!

I did not think I'd Like them as during preparation the worcestershire odor was overwhelming.
Needless to say after the seeds were cooked I ate them up.
So good!!!
They were great! Followed the recipe.

These were so addictive! I used half butter half olive oil instead of margarine and doubled all the spices, as other reviews suggested. They were so good and didn’t last long! My toddlers loved them too.
These have a strong flavor that is delicious! Easy to make! The hardest part is scooping them out of the pumpkin, but my kids took care of that.

Simmered the seeds (fresh out of the pumpkin) for 10 minutes in water with 1 teaspoon salt (read it's supposed to make it more easily digestible or something?) and patting them dry before going through this recipe. The smell out of the oven was driving us CRAZY! The taste was good but I think the smell is better, and that PRATE002 is right -double or triple the seasonings for sure. Great snack! Super easy.
I've tried other recipes but this one is the best. Flavorful and crispy. I used butter, garlic powder, regular & seasoned salt plus the Worcestershire sauce. Now how to store to keep them fresh?
Turned out very well. Seeds were rinsed right out of the pumpkin. Doubled the spices. Cooked for 70 min. Delicious!
great recipe! After the seeds cooked an hour they were still moist, so I turned them and cooked them another 1/2 hour. They are delicious.
None of us really like this
Delicious - I listened to the comments and really went heavily on the seasoning. Also added about 6 dashes of Tabasco - really gave it a nice zing!
I make this every Halloween and it's a hit! I even have people ask me for them every year now. Didn't change a thing
I added a little chili powder to this while baking them. It gave them a little more kick!
I boil them in salted water for 10 minuets first. Works great.
fantastic, i can't stop eating them! made it exactly as published, and they came out perfect!
The seeds tasted very good, but they came out greasy, even after roasting for an extra 10 minutes.
I followed the recipe and my family loved it!!
pretty good, have to make sure they are really dry before you cook them. I doubled spices.
Very good! Next time I shall brine the seeds first .
Delicious! Everyone who try them, love them & ask for more.
These are amazing!!! Extremely addictive, so beware! I was hesitant to try the recipe because of the Worcestershire sauce, but it's truly delicious! This will become a family tradition in our house!

I've been roasting pumpkin seeds around Halloween since I was a little kid and this is one of my favorite ways to have them. They're quite flavorful and easy to make. Just remember that they'll be on the sticky side due to the worcestershire sauce.
These are good. I feel like the flavour of the Worcestershire sauce is not as intense as it should be in the recipe, but overall I'm satisfied, thanks!
These are great!! They went faster than I could make them, though.

Delicious! I make this for my classroom every fall and they are a big hit! They always seem to take a little longer than stated, but I like mine to be crisp, not chewy, so that may just be a personal preference.
These were delicious followed recipe exactly!

Made this with a new type of pumpkin, but doubled seasonings (except wor sauce) per other reviews. Got busy decorating and they cooked a bit longer then stated. Still turned out nice. Will probably add more seasoning salt next time.
Made it with butter instead of oil, boiled the seeds day before. Baked for just under one hour ( I didn't want the seeds to get too crispy ). Turned out awesome! Love the smell from the oven!
Made exactly as specified! Wonderful flavor!
They were very good, and the only change that I made was to substitute the butter for oil so it wouldn't burn.
Best pumpkin seeds I've ever made. My daughter loved them.
They were good and very easy to make. I used seeds from the pumpkin and everyone liked them.
Excellent! No changes.
So Yummy! I followed the recipe ingredients exactly. I forgot to stir them and I left them in the oven a little longer than an hour and they still turned out super yummy.
A sure sign that fall is here! One of our family's favorites.
I made this for the first time two years ago and it has become a favorite! I do double up on the amount I use and add onion powder, pepper, and paprika. It is a hit with everyone that tries them.
Super salty, right on the verge of overboard but pretty addictive.

I made this recipe just as the recipe states and they were so good and tasty! One of the reviewers commented on the butter burning, but I had no trouble at all. At 275 degrees F, and stirring 3-4 times throughout, they cooked nice and crunchy. The house smelled wonderful and now my guys want to carve more pumpkins so we can have more seeds! Thanks for a great recipe! This will become a regular season pleaser for us.
